intro: Gilia scariosa, commonly known as the fringed gilia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It is a member of the evening primrose family (Onagraceae) and is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open areas such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its leaves are linear and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often branched. Gilia scariosa is known for its early blooming period, often appearing in late spring to early summer.
